korean: 안녕하세요, 오늘 하루 어땠어요?
english: Hi, how was your day today?

korean: 저는 지금 한국어를 연습하고 있어요.
english: I am practicing Korean right now.

korean: 잠깐만요, 다시 한 번 말해 주세요.
english: Wait a moment, please say that one more time.

korean: 이 근처에 맛있는 식당이 있어요?
english: Is there a good restaurant near here?

korean: 저는 커피보다 차를 더 좋아해요.
english: I like tea more than coffee.

korean: 오늘은 날씨가 정말 좋네요.
english: The weather is really nice today.

korean: 주말에 뭐 할 계획이에요?
english: What are your plans for the weekend?

korean: 저는 집에서 영화 보는 걸 좋아해요.
english: I like watching movies at home.

korean: 지하철역이 어디에 있는지 아세요?
english: Do you know where the subway station is?

korean: 천천히 말씀해 주시면 감사하겠습니다.
english: I would appreciate it if you spoke slowly.

korean: 지금 몇 시인지 알 수 있을까요?
english: Could you tell me what time it is now?

korean: 오늘 회의는 오후 세 시에 시작해요.
english: Today's meeting starts at 3 p.m.

korean: 배가 고파서 먼저 밥을 먹을게요.
english: I'm hungry, so I'll eat first.

korean: 저기 있는 파란 가방이 제 거예요.
english: That blue bag over there is mine.

korean: 문을 닫아도 될까요?
english: May I close the door?

korean: 괜찮아요, 천천히 하셔도 돼요.
english: It's okay, you can take your time.

korean: 오늘은 조금 피곤해서 일찍 잘 거예요.
english: I'm a little tired today, so I'll sleep early.

korean: 내일 아침에 같이 운동할래요?
english: Do you want to exercise together tomorrow morning?

korean: 이거 어떻게 사용하는지 알려 주세요.
english: Please show me how to use this.

korean: 생각보다 훨씬 재미있었어요.
english: It was much more fun than I expected.

korean: 요즘 바빠 보여요. 무슨 일 있어요?
english: You seem busy these days. Is something going on?

korean: 저는 매일 조금씩 단어를 외우고 있어요.
english: I memorize vocabulary a little bit every day.

korean: 이 문장은 일상 대화에서 자주 써요.
english: This sentence is often used in everyday conversation.

korean: 버스가 늦게 와서 조금 늦을 것 같아요.
english: The bus is late, so I think I'll be a little late.

korean: 비가 올 것 같으니까 우산 챙기세요.
english: It looks like rain, so bring an umbrella.

korean: 오늘 점심은 뭐 먹을지 아직 못 정했어요.
english: I haven't decided what to eat for lunch yet.

korean: 저는 매운 음식을 잘 못 먹어요.
english: I can't handle spicy food very well.

korean: 혹시 이 자리 비어 있나요?
english: Excuse me, is this seat taken?

korean: 길이 막혀서 예상보다 오래 걸렸어요.
english: Traffic was bad, so it took longer than expected.

korean: 사진 찍어 주실 수 있어요?
english: Could you take a picture for me?

korean: 오늘 수업에서 새로운 표현을 많이 배웠어요.
english: I learned a lot of new expressions in class today.

korean: 너무 걱정하지 마세요. 잘 될 거예요.
english: Don't worry too much. It will work out.

korean: 이 노래를 들으면 기분이 좋아져요.
english: This song makes me feel better.

korean: 퇴근하고 나서 바로 집에 갈 거예요.
english: I'm going straight home after work.

korean: 잠이 안 와서 책을 조금 읽었어요.
english: I couldn't sleep, so I read a little.

korean: 다음에는 같이 가면 좋겠어요.
english: It would be nice if we go together next time.

korean: 지금은 통화하기 어려워서 나중에 전화할게요.
english: It's hard to talk right now, so I'll call later.

korean: 이 문제는 생각보다 간단하네요.
english: This problem is simpler than I thought.

korean: 혹시 추천해 주실 만한 책이 있나요?
english: Do you have a book you would recommend?

korean: 조금 전에 보낸 메시지 확인했어요?
english: Did you check the message I sent a little while ago?

korean: 오늘 저녁에 시간 되면 잠깐 만날래요?
english: If you have time tonight, want to meet briefly?

korean: 저는 아침에 일찍 일어나는 편이에요.
english: I tend to wake up early in the morning.

korean: 처음에는 어려웠지만 이제 조금 익숙해졌어요.
english: It was difficult at first, but now I've gotten a bit used to it.

korean: 오늘은 집에서 푹 쉬는 게 좋겠어요.
english: It would be good to rest well at home today.

korean: 이거 가격이 조금 비싼 것 같아요.
english: I think this is a little expensive.

korean: 괜찮으면 창문 좀 열어도 될까요?
english: If it's okay, may I open the window a little?

korean: 제가 도와드릴 일이 있으면 말씀하세요.
english: If there's anything I can help with, please tell me.

korean: 요즘 한국 드라마를 보면서 공부하고 있어요.
english: These days I'm studying by watching Korean dramas.

korean: 발음이 아직 어색해서 계속 연습 중이에요.
english: My pronunciation is still awkward, so I'm still practicing.

korean: 그 말의 뜻을 정확히 이해하지 못했어요.
english: I didn't understand exactly what that meant.

korean: 여기 앉으세요. 제가 저쪽으로 갈게요.
english: Sit here. I'll move over there.

korean: 지금 출발하면 제시간에 도착할 수 있어요.
english: If we leave now, we can arrive on time.

korean: 생각날 때마다 큰 소리로 읽어 보세요.
english: Whenever you remember, try reading it out loud.

korean: 오늘은 발음보다 리듬에 집중해 볼게요.
english: Today I'll focus on rhythm more than pronunciation.

korean: 짧은 문장부터 천천히 연습하는 게 좋아요.
english: It's good to practice slowly starting with short sentences.

korean: 혹시 제가 틀리면 바로 고쳐 주세요.
english: If I make a mistake, please correct me right away.

korean: 들었을 때는 쉬운데 말하려면 어렵네요.
english: It's easy when I hear it, but hard when I try to say it.

korean: 오늘 연습은 여기까지 하고 내일 이어서 해요.
english: Let's stop practice here today and continue tomorrow.
